sections.heading: Violation; penalty.Any person who violates the Nebraska Health Care Certificate of Need Act by engaging in any activity which requires a certificate of need without first obtaining a certificate of need as required by the act or by engaging in an activity prohibited under the act is guilty of a Clas
sections.text: Violation; penalty.Any person who violates the Nebraska Health Care Certificate of Need Act by engaging in any activity which requires a certificate of need without first obtaining a certificate of need as required by the act or by engaging in an activity prohibited under the act is guilty of a Class IV misdemeanor. Each day of violation constitutes a separate offense. The magnitude of the violation is the primary consideration in establishing the amount of the fine.SourceLaws 1979, LB 172, ยง 70;Laws 1982, LB 378, ยง 55;Laws 1989, LB 429, ยง 39;Laws 1997, LB 798, ยง 36.
